articles.title: Railroads can reduce inspections
articles.description: The nation’s freight railroads are going to be able to try relying more on technology and inspect their tracks in person less often after the federal government approved their waiver request on Friday. The Association of American Railroads trade group asked for the relief from inspection requirements that were written back in 1971 because railroads […]
articles.content:
The nation’s freight railroads are going to be able to try relying more on technology and inspect their tracks in person less often after the federal government approved their waiver request on Friday.

An app rolled out by the Trump administration allowing local police to use facial recognition technology to identify illegal immigrants has been pulled from the Google Play Store, it was reported Friday.

articles.title: 3I/ATLAS: Harvard Scientist Says Alien 'Interstellar Gardener' Seeded Life on Earth
articles.description: Harvard scientist Avi Loeb claims the interstellar object 3I/ATLAS may be alien technology sent to seed life on Earth, sparking a debate with sceptics who insist it is merely a comet.
articles.content:
The arrival of the interstellar object 3I/ATLAS has reignited one of the most profound debates in science: whether Earth's biological history is unique or the result of ancient extraterrestrial intervention.
While mainstream astronomers classify the ... [4744 chars]

articles.title: How Today’s LASIK Technology Is Delivering the Best Vision Correction Ever
articles.description: LASIK has earned its place as one of the most trusted and transformative elective procedures in modern medicine. But the story isn’t just about freedom from glasses and contacts — it’s about how the current technology behind LASIK has reached a level of precision and personalization that would have been unimaginable even a decade ago. articles.title: Industry-Academia partnership no longer by choice, sole option for growth: Dr Jitendra
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Dec 5: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology; Earth Sciences and Minister of State for PMO, Department of Atomic Energy, Department of Space, Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Dr. Jitendra Singh said here today that in present global scenario, Industry-Academia partnership is no longer by choice, but is the sole option for growth. He called for deeper and sustained collaboration between industry, academia, and government, stating that such partnerships are no longer […]

articles.title: Doctrine of ‘Atma Nirbhar-Bharat’ gets a boost
articles.description: Ashwani Kumar Chrungoo ashwanikc2012@gmail.com The vision of ‘Atma Nirbhar-Bharat’ (self-reliant India) was adopted by the government of India headed by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi immediately after the assumption of power in 2014 as its doctrine of governance. Policies of the government made it a fundamental aspect of all major decisions having short-term and long-term impact upon the onward march of the nation. Its reflection can be found in many fields like manufacturing, import and export, technology, defence production and […]

articles.title: No defence deal, India and Russia agree to boost manufacture of spare parts
articles.description: India and Russia have agreed to work together under the Make-in-India program to manufacture spare parts and components for Russian arms and defence equipment. This will involve technology transfer and joint ventures to meet the needs of the Indian Armed Forces and enable exports.
articles.content:
India 14 min ago
This is an AI assisted summary.
India and Russia have agreed to work together under the Make-in-India program to manufacture spare parts and components for Russian arms and defence equipment. This will involve technology transfer and... [21920 chars]

articles.title: No defence deal, India and Russia agree to boost manufacture of spare parts
articles.description: The move, under the Make-in-India programme, will involve technology transfer and the setting up of joint ventures to meet the needs of the Indian Armed Forces and enable exports to mutually friendly third countries.
articles.content:
The announcement was part of a joint statement issued after Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Russian President Vladimir Putin.
Despite defence ties being a key focus, no new defence deal was announced in the joint statement.
The Modi-Putin talks foll... [1513 chars]
